    Sample Spaces

    Sample Spaces

    Sample spaces are used to encode the feasible space of binary two-stage designs for optimization. Currently, only a single option SimpleSampleSpace exists which allows to specify a range of possible stage-one sample sizes, maximal overall sample size and various nicety constraints.

    BinaryTwoStageDesigns.SampleSpace — Type.
    SampleSpace

    Abstract type representing generic sample spaces defining the search space for finding optimal two stage designs.

    source
    BinaryTwoStageDesigns.SimpleSampleSpace — Method.
    SimpleSampleSpace{T<:Integer}(n1range, nmax::T; n2min::T = 1, maxnfact::Real = Inf, nmincont::T = 0, maxvariables::T = 500000, GS::Bool = false)

    Constructs an object of type SimpleSampleSpace defining the search space for finding optimal two stage designs.

    Parameters

    ParameterDescription
    n1rangepossible stage-one sample sizes, can be anything which is convertable to an integer vector
    n2minminimal stage-two sample size
    nmaxmaximal overall sample size (stage one and two combined)
    maxnfactnmax must be smaller than maxnfact*n1
    nmincontminimal sample size upon rejection of the null hypothesis
    maxvariables(approximate) maximal number of binary variables used when finding optimal design; if the sample space is too big this can be used to find approximate solutions to the optimization problem
    GSflag indicating wheather the design should be group-sequential (constant stage two sample size upon continuation)

    Return Value

    An object of type SimpleSampleSpace with the respective parameters.

    Examples

    julia> SimpleSampleSpace(10:25, 100, n2min = 5)
    source
